intro: Brunellia comocladiifolia subsp. boyacensis, commonly known as the Boyacensis Brunellia, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and dense, dark green color. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within montane forests.
